history.content:
I am currently taking Stat133, CS61C, CS70, and NutriSci 10. 

It's a lot and not fun but it is doable. 

Since you have (presumably) taken 61a and 61b, Stat133 will be pretty chill  - the class isn't very hard, the only reall effort you will need to put in will be for the 5 or 6 hw assignments, which take about 4 hours. 

The combination of 61c+70 will be diffult, because both are a heavy workload. The hardest part is that their midterms are one day after each other, with a project due around the same time. My advice: don't do what I did and ignore taking practice exams in favor of finishing the project (you gotta balance it better). 

Someone else may need to answer about 61c being good for internships - I don't know if I have enough expertise. My only thought is that it depends on what type of internship you are going for. 

___
To answer 61C's usefulness, it basically depends on the internship. My first internship was in computer architecture, naturally 61C was crucial. On the other hand, it probably isn't helpful for web development for example. But even if it isn't directly applicable I feel like 61C knowledge is good to have in general.

children.subject:
To followup with Anonymous, 61c knowledge is good to have. 

I am not interested in computer architecture and took this class as a requirement, but I didn't expect to learn as much as I did. 

In the first lecture, Weaver said "After this class, computers will no longer be magic to you". And its true - I understand most of the fundamental workings of a computer. 

You don't have to enjoy 61c to appreciate what you learned it valuable

history.content: Hi, how manageable is stat 133, cs61c and cs70 for fall semester? I know this is a lot. Also, how crucial is cs61c for internships?
history.subject: Fall 2018 Class Load
